item.title: Identifiers - Best Practices and Use Cases
item.description: Identifiers Identifiers are names assigned to elements like variables, functions, or types in a program, helping programmers identify and reference specific elements in the source code. ✍ Syntax Common Identifier Syntax <Initial_Char><Initial_Char | Digits>* Read More ✍ Syntax Quoted Identifier '<Initial_Char | Digits>* Read More ✍ Syntax Character Escaping \u{<Digits>} \<Char> Read More ✍ Syntax Qualified Identifier <module-prefix-identifier>:<identifier> Read More Using suitable identifiers is crucial for creating readable and understandable code.

item.title: How to Use Comments
item.description: Comments Comments are used to provide more details about the code or temporally disable a section of the source code. ✍ Syntax // A comment starts with two forward slashes //. The compiler ignores any characters between // and the end of the line. Ballerina supports only single-line comments. Highlights Multiline comments are not supported. This is solely for comments. For documentation and annotation, different syntax is required. Refrain from documenting within comments; utilize Markdown syntax instead.
